column4: hey i need sum help installing flash on ubuntu anyone know the yum command
How are you using yum on ubuntu?
tyvm ??
did you want something?
You have another instance of a package manager open
You'll get better!  Everyone starts where you are now
I think I can.  Are you trying to get it to work in firefox??
Open up synaptic.  Do you know what that is?  and search for "flash"
Ok, first un-install EVERYTHING that comes up from the search for "flash" you can only have 1 version of flash installed or they fight each other and it won't work.
what is showing as installed? just flashplugin-nonfree   ?
so now there is no flash players installed?
Organize the packages by what's installed.  It is critical that none of them are installed right now

ok good.  Now you have a couple options.  There is the version from adobe (flashplugin-nonfree) if you're convinced that doesn't work I suggest gnash it's second best in my opinion but be warned flashplugin-nonfree is the best by far and works on the most sites
try gnash it works on youtube at least
You install gnash, restarted firefox completely and then tried you tube?
It is possible that firefox is not completely restarting.  Look in it's plugins what is showing as the flash player?
Try installing the -dev do you understand?  It's a good idea hyperstream! :)
sudo apt-get install  libpango1.0-dev
from gdebi still?
ha ha
See our personal convo
